column11: Strong waves and undercurrent makes it nott very suitable for not strong swimmers especially children
It is a nice beach, with great sunsets but the water is usually rough and swimming is a bit dangerous.
As most of the beaches around Tangalle, its an amazing stretch of Sand, but not suitable for swimming. For swimming try 'Silent Beach' west of town.
For a distance the coconut beach looks great - its only as you cone close that you realise its got quite a big swell and the water isnt that clear. I wouldnt swim there again.
Beautiful place, very nice! Multi-colored sand, warm ocean, though the waves were very strong. And here it is very lonely! Many housing on the coast, is where to eat.

Long lengthy beach line is there. Very economical place. Food and rooms are very cheap.  Good place for backpackers.  So many restaurants for fresh sea foods. Economical beautiful place with lagoon and backside. You can go kayak in the lagoon
Very nice beach with a great sunset and endless stretches of sand shrouded in coconut trees. The waves are strong and I didn't swim.
Excellent........!!!!!!!!!!  and i haven't words to say about that experience. Awesome... Great experience....!!!!! ♡♡♡♡♡¤♡¤¤ :D
A very pretty beach and good for a swim and to play in the waves. Not many other tourists around, even in peak season.

Though this beach is sandy and long, we found the water rough and the drop off steep in places. Maybe we were just unlucky the day we went, but litter and local beach boys from nearby Tangalle town who stare/hound you seem to be more permanent problems. Some decent restaurants nearby to choose from though the fare seemed to only be curry or seafood, salad & chips. Given some of the other outstanding beaches west of Tangalle, heading towards Mirissa, better to explore further.

Medaketiya beach is a great place to swim and eat. There are plenty of beachside cafés and cheap accommodation. The town end of the beach is a little industrialized but the further east you go, the better the beach. At the eastern end of the beach is situated the mid to upper price bracket hotels.
I am afraid to sleap on beach at night, therefor selected Mahawewa Nature Resort bit far  from the beach to rest and sleep

I just want to let you know that we spent the last 4 days here at shehani guesthouse and it was definitively the correct decision to stay here. The owner and his family are very very kind and friendly and always try to help you out and feel comfortable. The rooms were very clean but simple, with big bathrooms and beach infront. They offer several meals for the typical tourist price but still fair and very delicious! WiFi included. Unfortunately there are many stones at the shore so that it is really dangerous to go swimming in front of the bungalows. But few meters to right you can swim easily!

Tangalla is by far the nicest beach we've seen during our trip in Sri Lanka. We highly recommend "Shehani guesthouse". I do not find this guesthouse on tripadvisor, but I would like to share my experiences about this guesthouse anyway. The guesthouse is located almost next to the Ibis guesthouse. Its run by a Sri Lankan family. They have one cabana and three rooms. We got a simple but clean and cosy room with outdoor bathroom for only 3000 rupee a night. The breakfast they serve is really good and there's a choice between a wide range of food. the restaurant is right at the beach, its just amazing to eat under the palmtrees. We would recommend this guesthouse to everyone!

Like many beaches in Tangalle, this one is beautiful with endless stretches of sand shrouded in coconut trees. However, do not venture out far as the waves are strong and the undertow (current pulling you into the ocean) can be extremely dangerous. Also, as the beach is across from a road, you notice locals staring at tourists in skimpy bikinis, so be careful crossing the street as drivers are very distracted!

It was a really great discovery, this Medaketiya Beach. I was on a bike and was disappointed with how strong are the waves then found this. At first I had to cross a lagoon (fearing some snakes which had none) before being completely lost on a dreamy isolation! It was paradise!

beautiful beach but almost deserted, even any little restaurants that had been there before were in ruins. its so unspoilt. if you like this scene its the place to be but we felt after one day it was time to move to somewhere with a bit of life.

We thought we had stepped onto a film set when we arrived at Medaketiya. Golden sands, crashing waves and palm trees. The area was unspoiled by tourists and was generally quiet... the strength of the waves shouldn't be ignored though, even paddling can result in being swept off your feet and sunglasses flying off your face!
